results.title: The Road home
results.brief_description: One of the most dramatic stories from a young aspiring filmmaker with autism who lost everything - his home, his camera and film equipment. Starting to rebuild now and a strong family network.

results.title: Into the flames
results.brief_description: A personal account of ‘Black Saturday’ bushfires from a young leader, a volunteer from CFA Region 14. Simon speaks of his experiences fighting the blaze - monitoring where campers are located, through to anger from local residents directed at his crew in the heat and panic of the fires.
results.description: A personal account of ‘Black Saturday’ bushfires from a young leader, a volunteer from CFA Region 14. Simon speaks of his experiences fighting the blaze - monitoring where campers are located, through to anger from local residents directed at his crew in the heat and panic of the fires.
description_for_label: A personal account of ‘Black Saturday’ bushfires from a young leader, a volunteer from CFA Region 14. results.title: Fire threat
results.brief_description: A young mum recounts her stress at her partner deciding to stay in Warburton while she and her young daughter go to her mum’s house. She speaks about her ‘uni days’ and the change in priorities now that she is a mum.
results.description: A young mum recounts her stress at her partner deciding to stay in Warburton while she and her young daughter go to her mum’s house. She speaks about her ‘uni days’ and the change in priorities now that she is a mum.

results.title: In a knot
results.brief_description: ‘Warburton, which is practically my life.’ A sparse story, fairly poetic, about her stress and anxiety and fighting with her family. Amazing photos - from a light plane looking over the ‘Black Saturday’ affected areas.

results.title: Two worlds: one me
results.creator_credit: Elinor Moshe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Born in Israel during the Gulf War but eventually moving to Australia, Elinor Moshe finds herself caught between two countries, cultures and traditions.

results.title: Gia mas (About us)
results.creator_credit: Parthena Savvidou, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After her mother left, Parthena Savvidou and her father fled to Greece to live with Parthena’s grandparents for six years before their eventual return to Australia. This story is about Parthena’s memories of life in Greece and her special relationship with her father. A thank you from a daughter to her father.

results.description: After her mother left, Parthena Savvidou and her father fled to Greece to live with Parthena’s grandparents for six years before their eventual return to Australia. This story is about Parthena’s memories of life in Greece and her special relationship with her father. A thank you from a daughter to her father.

results.title: The Tran family
results.creator_credit: Thuy Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
This story is dedicated to Thuy Tran’s father who suddenly found himself raising a family of six young children single-handedly when his wife unexpectedly passed away.
A brief introduction to each member of the Tran family is presented along with a personal tribute from Thuy to her father.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thuy Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description:
This story is dedicated to Thuy Tran’s father who suddenly found himself raising a family of six young children single-handedly when his wife unexpectedly passed away.
A brief introduction to each member of the Tran family is presented along with a personal tribute from Thuy to her father.

results.title: Yodit and I
results.creator_credit: Duaa Mahmoud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tale of heroic acts of a mother’s quest to return her son safe and sound from the battlefields of East Africa in 1896. This inspiring story of Yodit, now half legend, stays alive as it is passed down from one generation to the next.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Duaa Mahmoud, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: A tale of heroic acts of a mother’s quest to return her son safe and sound from the battlefields of East Africa in 1896. This inspiring story of Yodit, now half legend, stays alive as it is passed down from one generation to the next.

results.title: A Sad realisation
results.creator_credit: Vivian Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The sight of ugly bare land and the sound of heavy machinery where once stood a forest of trees are all too real for Vivian Tran to block out. Trees cannot protect themselves against being logged. A poignant story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vivian Tran, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: The sight of ugly bare land and the sound of heavy machinery where once stood a forest of trees are all too real for Vivian Tran to block out. Trees cannot protect themselves against being logged. A poignant story.
